author: GamingBolt
description:
Dying Light: The Beast is poised to be one of 2025’s standout survival horror titles thanks to Techland’s ambition to craft a sprawling open world in meticulous artistic detail. The Beast’s setting of Castor Woods is both serene and disturbing, a former vacation destination turned bloodsoaked wasteland, where diverse biomes dictate player movement, combat, and survival strategy. 

From exposed grasslands to dense woodland, every location fosters dread and tension, while intricate blood detail and environmental storytelling encourage players to remap the brutality besieging the humans that were left behind to forge survival in the face of unfathomable horror. 

Parkour and resource scavenging evolve into lifelines, whilst the stalking undead provide newfound unpredictability. Loyal fans of the franchise, primed by years of support, are ready for an expansion of Dying Light’s formula, and The Beast is ready to deliver.
title: Why Dying Light: The Beast Is All Set To Be One of the Biggest Games of 2025

author: GamingBolt
description:
With Borderlands 4 nearly upon us, launching on September 12th for Xbox Series X/S, PS5, and PC (Switch 2 players will have to wait until October 3rd), it's a good time to look back on everything that's changed and improved over Borderlands 3. 

The latter divided fans pretty heavily, which is a nice way of putting it, but Borderlands 4 does a lot more than just address those misgivings. Here are 15 significant differences between the titles before you buy.
title: Borderlands 4 vs Borderlands 3 - 15 BIGGEST Changes You May Not Know
